history.proof: intros g P H1 H2. apply H1, H2.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (g : Prop) (P : Type), (Marker.group g -> P) -> Marker.end_defer g -> P

Premises:
Module Marker := Struct Definition end_defer : Type -> Type. Definition group : Prop -> Prop. Parameter group_fold : forall P : Prop, P -> group P. End 
Marker.group = fun P : Prop => P : Prop -> Prop Arguments Marker.group _%type_scope
Marker.end_defer = fun P : Type => P : Type -> Type Arguments Marker.end_defer _%type_scope
ssrbool.and4_rect : forall (P1 P2 P3 P4 : Prop) (P : Type), (P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> P) -> ssrbool.and4 P1 P2 P3 P4 -> P
ssrbool.and4_rec : forall (P1 P2 P3 P4 : Prop) (P : Set), (P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> P) -> ssrbool.and4 P1 P2 P3 P4 -> P
BinNat.N.eqf = fun f g : BinNums.N -> bool => forall n : BinNums.N, f n = g n : (BinNums.N -> bool) -> (BinNums.N -> bool) -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
VectorDef.Exists_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> SProp), (forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), P x -> P0 (S m) (VectorDef.cons A x m v)) -> (forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), VectorDef.Exists P v -> P0 m v -> P0 (S m) (VectorDef.cons A x m v)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t A n), VectorDef.Exists P t -> P0 n t
Inductive Exists (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> Prop := Exists_cons_hd : forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), P x -> VectorDef.Exists P (VectorDef.cons A x m v) | Exists_cons_tl : forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), VectorDef.Exists P v -> VectorDef.Exists P (VectorDef.cons A x m v) Arguments VectorDef.Exists {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {n}%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.Exists_cons_hd {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {m}%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.Exists_cons_tl {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {m}%nat_scope
ssrbool.prop_on2 : forall T1 T2 T3 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall (f : T1 -> T2) (Pf : (T1 -> T2) -> T3) (P : T1 -> T1 -> Prop), ssreflect.phantom T3 (Pf f) -> ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x y : T1, P x y) -> Prop
RingMicromega.Op1_rect : forall P : RingMicromega.Op1 -> Type, P RingMicromega.Equal -> P RingMicromega.NonEqual -> P RingMicromega.Strict -> P RingMicromega.NonStrict -> forall o : RingMicromega.Op1, P o
BinPos.Pos.PeanoView_rect : forall P : forall p : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.PeanoView p -> Type, P BinNums.xH BinPos.Pos.PeanoOne -> (forall (p : BinNums.positive) (p0 : BinPos.Pos.PeanoView p), P p p0 -> P (BinPos.Pos.succ p) (BinPos.Pos.PeanoSucc p p0)) -> forall (p : BinNums.positive) (p0 : BinPos.Pos.PeanoView p), P p p0
Marker.group_fold : forall P : Prop, P -> Marker.group P
Ring_theory.morph_opp : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x))
Ring_theory.morph_eq : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x y : C, ceqb x y = true -> req (phi x) (phi y)
Decidable.decidable = fun P : Prop => P \/ ~ P : Prop -> Prop Arguments Decidable.decidable _%type_scope
Inductive and4 (P1 P2 P3 P4 : Prop) : Prop := And4 : P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> ssrbool.and4 P1 P2 P3 P4 Arguments ssrbool.and4 (_ _ _ _)%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.And4 [P1 P2 P3 P4]%type_scope

Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x)); morph_eq : forall...
Record ring_eq_ext (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_reqe { Radd_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) radd; Rmul_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rmul; Ropp_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req req) ropp } Arguments Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext [R]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Ring_theory.mk_reqe [R]%type_scope [radd rmul ropp req]%function_scope

PeanoNat.Nat.rs_rs' : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, A z -> (forall n : nat, z <= n -> A n -> A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, z <= n -> (forall m : nat, z <= m -> m < n -> A m) -> A n
